formElement.label: Configuration name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Data Source Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the Data Source. This will also serve as the unique identifier for this resource. For example XAOracleDS

formElement.label: JNDI Name:
formElement.documentation: JNDI Name of the Data Source. For example java:/XAOracleDS

formElement.label: JDBC Driver Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the JDBC Driver of the Database for which the XA Data source is created. For example oracle.

formElement.label: XA Data Source Properties:
formElement.documentation: A comma-separated list of XA data source properties in key=value pair format. Note that the key value pairs are database dependent and at a minimum should contain the Database connection information. For example: url=jdbc:oracle:oci8:@tc for an Oracle database; DatabaseName=mysqlDB,ServerName=localhost,PortNumber=3306 for a Mysql database.

formElement.label: Data Source Connection Credentials:
formElement.documentation: Username and password used for the connection, that will be included as part of the step

formElement.label: Enabled:
formElement.documentation: If the created XA Data Source should be enabled or not. Default is Y. Note that for an Update to go through it should be disabled prior.

formElement.label: Profile:
formElement.documentation: Required for Domain, will be ignored for Standalone. Name of profile in Domain where XA data source should be created or updated (in case of need). For example: 'full', 'default'

formElement.label: Additional Options:
formElement.documentation: This is meant to pass additional options for both these use cases: 1. To override parameters which are defaulted (for example Interleaving, PadXID etc.). 2. Optional parameters which are not defaulted (for example min-pool-size, max-pool-size, --check-valid-connection-sql etc.)
